Pat Farrell wrote:
> 
> 
> Java has been multi-threaded from the start, and Java 5 has native API
> support for things like Barriers that used to be rolled by a toolsmith
> reading the O'Reilly "Java Threads" book.
> 
> It is not clear to me how to use JUnit to test multi-thread applications.
> 
> Is it possible?
> Any hints and tips?

Yes, it's possible. When Manning's "TDD in Action" comes out, Lasse 
Koskela will have told you how. I haven't done much multithreading work 
myself, since I tend to use platforms that do that for me. That's why I 
don't have specific advice for you, except to make the threading 
pluggable so that you can test your logic in a single-threaded mode 
first. I'd hate to be looking for logic and threading problems together.
